cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northwest tonight and then accelerate north-northeast toward the northeast Gulf Coast of Florida, crossing the peninsula and emerging off the southeast U.S. coast late this week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect – interests in central and northern Florida advised to monitor.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of the Florida peninsula from the Keys northward through the Big Bend, then the southeast U.S. coast into Georgia and the Carolinas.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 mph, higher gusts) possible late Wednesday night into Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft surge in and near Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 15 inches possible, creating flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Flash flooding and isolated tornadoes associated with outer rainbands.
